revised_title: Determination of the Heating-Powers of Arcturus and a Lyrae
tldr: The author describes a method for measuring the heating power of stars, specifically Arcturus and a Lyrae, using a telescope, a thermo-electric pile, and a reflecting astatic galvanometer. The results show that Arcturus has a heating effect of approximately 0.0198°F on the plate of antimony and bismuth when the heat is condensed by the object-glass of 12.75 inches.
